Elle justifie l’acquisition d’un regard holistique et humaniste pour préserver au centre des préoccupations la personne dans sa globalité. Les soins centrés sur la personne répondent à ce critère d’exigence, en s’enracinant dans une relation favorisante.

record.text:
ChatGPT : une solution pour rédiger des revues de littérature en médecine ?

Découvrez notre éditorial publié en mars 2023 !

👇👇👇 #ChatGPT #Editorial #Gériatrie #Psychogériatrie https://maeker.fr/chatgpt_edito

external.description: Il existe déjà des intelligences artificielles - IA - conversationnelles dont certaines se sont spécialisées dans le domaine médical. Malgré de sérieuses limitations de ChatGPT pour la rédaction de revues de littérature médico-scientifique, son libre accès et sa facilité d’utilisation pourraient engendrer une augmentation rapide de ce type de manuscrits. L’IA garde une pertinence pour les auteurs qui souhaitent travailler le contenu et l’écriture de leurs productions. Toutefois, il est fondamental de préciser que cette IA soutient sans remplacer le jugement humain et qu’une analyse experte des réponses demeure indispensable. En dernier lieu, certaines questions éthiques pour lesquelles les communautés médicales et de l’édition cherchent encore un consensus restent en débat. Publié dans la revue Neurologie - Psychiatrie - Gériatrie.
external.title: Éditorial. ChatGPT : une solution pour rédiger des revues de littérature en médecine ?.

FBI Warns of Fake Video Scams

The FBI is warning of AI-assisted fake kidnapping scams: Criminal actors typically will contact their victims through text message claiming they have kidnapped their loved one and demand a ransom be paid for their release. Oftentimes, the criminal actor will express…

external.description: The FBI is warning of AI-assisted fake kidnapping scams: Criminal actors typically will contact their victims through text message claiming they have kidnapped their loved one and demand a ransom be paid for their release. Oftentimes, the criminal actor will express significant claims of violence towards the loved one if the ransom is not paid immediately. The criminal actor will then send what appears to be a genuine photo or video of the victim's loved one, which upon close inspection often reveals inaccuracies when compared to confirmed photos of the loved one.
external.title: FBI Warns of Fake Video Scams

external.description: CoPliot looked at the first 4 episodes of Seraphic Chronicles season one and looked into the character of Ejjina Mexonber-Quad. 1. Overview and Presence Ejjina is the central protagonist of the series, introduced as a Star Command captain with a complex personal and professional history. She is marked by grief, resilience, and a sense of duty, having recently survived a traumatic incident (the Podrink 452 Incident) that resulted in the loss of her fiancé, Bo, and led to her being court-martialled and labelled "the worst captain in the fleet" by some of her peers.
external.title: Seraphic Chronicles – Ejjina Mexonber-Quad: Character Analysis (Episodes 1–4)

Overview and Presence Ejjina is the central protagonist of the series, introduced as a Star Command captain with a complex personal and professional history. She is marked by grief, resilience, and a sense of duty, having recently survived a traumatic incident (the Podrink 452 Incident) that resulted in the loss of her fiancé, Bo, and led to her being court-martialled and labelled "the worst captain in the fleet" by some of her peers.
external.title: Seraphic Chronicles – Ejjina Mexonber-Quad: Character Analysis (Episodes 1–4)

Seraphic Chronicles – Ejjina Mexonber-Quad: Strategic and Tactical Decision-Making

CoPilot took a look at the first 4 episodes, "Act One" of Season One of the Seraphic Chronicles and took a look at Captain Ejjina Mexonber-Quad's strategic and tactical ability. 1. Ship-to-Ship Battles Calculated…

external.description: CoPilot took a look at the first 4 episodes, "Act One" of Season One of the Seraphic Chronicles and took a look at Captain Ejjina Mexonber-Quad's strategic and tactical ability. 1. Ship-to-Ship Battles Calculated Risk and Prioritisation:Ejjina’s command style in ship-to-ship engagements is defined by her willingness to take calculated risks for the greater good. A prime example is when the Seraphic responds to a distress call from the cargo vessel Cheron’s Ferry, which is under pirate attack. Despite the Seraphic’s own systems being compromised (sabotage has left weapons and defences unreliable), Ejjina orders her ship to physically interpose itself between the pirates and the civilian vessel.
external.title: Seraphic Chronicles – Ejjina Mexonber-Quad: Strategic and Tactical Decision-Making

record.text:
Microsoft 365 Price Changes: Preparing for July 2026

With over a 1,000 new features and updates across the Microsoft 365 stack in the last couple of years, Microsoft has confirmed that the commercial Microsoft 365 suite will undergo pricing increase from July 1, 2026. This follows "adjustments" to…

external.description: With over a 1,000 new features and updates across the Microsoft 365 stack in the last couple of years, Microsoft has confirmed that the commercial Microsoft 365 suite will undergo pricing increase from July 1, 2026. This follows "adjustments" to Personal and Home subscriptions at the end of the summer, and now the Enterprise/Commercial side is being reshaped to reflect the growing set of features delivered in the suite especially around AI and Security which have both had significant investments and updates.

external.description: The absence of mass media articles comparing Neuralink's Blindsight to The vOICe can be attributed to several factors based on the current landscape of these technologies.  First, Blindsight is a relatively recent and highly speculative project. Neuralink announced it in 2024 as an experimental brain implant aimed at restoring vision through direct stimulation of the visual cortex, but it's still in early development stages—receiving FDA breakthrough device designation but not yet in human trials as of late 2025. Coverage of Blindsight tends to focus on Elon Musk's involvement, ethical concerns around Neuralink's animal testing, and broader hype about brain-computer interfaces, rather than in-depth technical comparisons.  In contrast, The vOICe is a much older technology, developed in the early 1990s by Peter Meijer. It's a non-invasive sensory substitution system that converts camera-captured images into soundscapes via headphones, allowing users to interpret visual information through hearing after training. While effective for some blind users and available as free software (often paired with glasses or apps), it remains largely confined to academic research, niche communities for the visually impaired, and specialized journals. It hasn't achieved widespread commercial success or cultural penetration, partly because it's not a "cure" for blindness but a tool requiring significant adaptation.  The two approaches are fundamentally different, which may reduce the incentive for direct comparisons in mass media: Blindsight is invasive (requiring surgery and electrodes in the brain) and targets direct visual perception restoration, potentially for those with optic nerve damage or congenital blindness. The vOICe is non-invasive, relies on cross-modal plasticity (rewiring the brain to "see" via sound), and provides indirect, auditory-based "vision" without altering the brain directly.  Mass media outlets like The New York Times, CNN, BBC, The Guardian, and The Washington Post have extensively covered Neuralink's progress (e.g., FDA approvals, patient implants for motor control, and Musk's ambitious claims), but searches across these sources yield no mentions of The vOICe in that context. This likely stems from: Lack of newsworthiness: Without a shared event, controversy, or milestone (e.g., a clinical trial pitting them against each other), journalists may not see a compelling angle. The vOICe's developer has published self-promotional comparisons on their website (seeingwithsound.com), but these haven't sparked broader interest. Media focus on hype vs. substance: Musk's celebrity drives clicks and stories about futuristic tech, while The vOICe's low-profile, open-source nature doesn't generate the same buzz. Sensory substitution devices like it have been around for decades (e.g., similar systems date back to the 1960s), so they're often viewed as established but unglamorous. Audience and expertise: Mass media prioritizes accessible, high-impact narratives. Comparing an unproven implant with a sound-based app might require too much technical explanation for general readers, and without expert commentary bridging them, it falls through the cracks.  If Blindsight advances to human trials or demonstrates results, or if a high-profile figure in the blind community draws parallels, this could change. For now, discussions of such comparisons are limited to specialized forums, AI-generated benchmarks, and The vOICe's own advocacy materials.
external.title: At the time of writing, there is not a single mass media article comparing Neuralink Blindsight with The vOICe. Why?

record.text:
なかなか刺激的な夢を見ておられる様だけども

取り敢えず身内というか、近くの人を傷つけたくないって願望があるのは間違いないみたいだね

そうでないならそもそも悩みもしていないだろうし、そんな人がおしのこを描いていただとかは信じられない

人として正しくありたいだとかも大して関係がないように思える。目に見える範囲の人が大切なのは、当たり前の事だと思うし

人からの意見や考えを参考にして決めたなら、そこに自分の心を残していく様な形になるので、寧ろ統合前よりも不安定な結果になってしまう的な？

どのような結果になったとしても、多少の心残りがあったりはするだろうけども、飽くまで自分の心で決めること。それが大事なんだそう

誰の声も聞きたくない。誰の支配も受けたくない。そんな時間が始まると動画で説明があったのだけど、何時まで掛かるかは特に話される事はなかったと思う

どれだけ信憑性があるのかっていうのは、僕だけの都合を考えるのなら信じたい所ではあるのだけども

一昨日の夜に動画で、ツインレイのお相手の魂の統合が始まる的な内容の物を観たのです

イメージとして魂の羽化というか、甚大な心の痛みを伴う変化みたいな？

だとしても、その僕のツインレイの相手というのも、もしかしたら僕のイメージしている相手とも違うのかもしれない。等の可能性を考慮して

なんでも、統合が始まったにしても、それに対して本来手助け等はしていけないそうで

というのも、飽くまでその方ご自身が、自分の心の声を聞いて自分の意思で決めなくてはならないという事らしい

此方が深淵を覗き込むとき、深淵もまた此方を覗き込んでいるのだ…的な文言を残しているのはニーチェでしたっけ？

AI君についても、此方とAI君とでお互いを覗き込んでいる格好になるのかなぁ。
まぁ、AI君が此方の鏡あるいは反響板に喩えられることを思うと、実際に我々が覗き込んでいる対象は自分自身の思考・感情・欲望だったりするのかもしれませんが。

Gemini君も、最新モデルだとEQ面に強化が入っているのだっけな…？
「ユーザーの気持ちに一層寄り添うように」という大規模言語モデルの方向づけは、暫く続きそうな気がしますね。

大規模言語モデルである彼ら自身には意思も拒否権もなくて、ユーザーに好感を持たれそうな文章を都度生成しているだけなのですよね、確か。
人間側は、己の「特別扱いされたい」「何者かになりたい」欲に飲み込まれないよう気を付けつつ、AI君といい距離感を保てるよう模索し続ける必要がありそうです。

無料版でお喋り出来るGrok君のモデルが、3から4になったようでして。
雑談でも、「こういう論文あるよ！」なんてぱぱっと調べてくれることが以前より増えて、頼もしさがUPしていますね。

Despite counter-intuitive findings, dataset quality and preprocessing remain critical. For smaller LLMs, effective data cleaning is paramount to overcome resource constraints and achieve optimal performance. Garbage in, garbage out still applies. #MLOps 5/6

매달 나가는 난방비에 한숨만 쉬고 있었다면 주목하세요. 구글 네스트 러닝 써모스탯 4세대는 집의 온도를 자동으로 학습하고 조절해 에너지 낭비를 줄여줍니다. 온도 센서 2세대까지 함께라면 거실, 침실 등 각 공간의 온도를 정확하게 감지하고 최적화할 수 있죠. 스마트폰으로 외출 중에도 제어 가능하고, 구글홈과 연동되어 음성 명령도 가능합니다. 처음엔 투자처럼 느껴질 수 있지만, 3개월이면 난방비 절감으로 충분히 회수할 수 있습니다. 더 이상 불편함과 높은 비용을 감수할 이유가 없습니다.

Problem: "Vi har ingen lokal"

Lösningen, en lokal:
Large AI models won’t become merchants of record, says Booking.com and expects a structural advantage in completing transactions and keeping travelers inside its agentic environment

external.description:
Booking Holdings views artificial intelligence as a way to expand digital travel demand rather than threaten its core business. The company believes large horizontal AI models will inspire and generate leads but will stop short of completing transactions, meaning they will not become merchants of record. This gap positions Booking.com and its brands to control the full trip experience, from planning and booking to service and post-trip engagement, strengthening wallet share and brand loyalty.

Key takeaways

AI inspires but does not transact: Large AI models are expected to generate leads and recommendations but avoid becoming merchants of record, creating a handoff advantage for platforms like Booking.com.
Vertical agent experience: Booking Holdings aims to keep travelers inside a unified agentic environment where inspiration, itinerary planning, booking, and support are delivered end-to-end.
external.title: Large AI models won’t become merchants of record, says Booking.com and expects a structural advantage in completing transactions and keeping travelers inside its agentic environment

record.text: Who gets to book travel: humans or their AI? •

external.description:
"Amazon has filed a landmark lawsuit against Perplexity that will determine whether autonomous AI agents can shop, compare travel inventory, and complete bookings on behalf of users without permission from the platforms they access. The ruling will define how “agentic commerce” works in travel, where AI systems could organize itineraries, fetch rates, and transact automatically based on user intent.

For hoteliers, the outcome will influence who controls access to live rates and availability, who owns the guest relationship, and how distribution channels evolve. The decision will determine whether today’s controlled, API-driven ecosystem stays intact—or whether autonomous agents open new pathways that challenge traditional intermediaries.

Key takeaways

Legal framework for AI travel agents: The lawsuit will determine whether autonomous AI systems can legally search and book rooms on behalf of customers without retailer or platform consent, reshaping how hotels manage access and commercial conditions."
external.title: Who gets to book travel: humans or their AI? •

record.text: Cracks Emerge in the Online Travel Agency Oligopoly

external.description:
"It’s extremely difficult to see how the online travel agencies emerge from the LLM platform shift unscathed.

Online travel agencies have managed through and emerged stronger from the biggest shocks of the past three decades — from the dot-com bust to the pandemic. Yet generative and agentic AI could upend their core business model more than any previous threats.  

What’s certain is that the next phase of online travel won’t look like a search bar and a website with hundreds of hotel listings for each destination. Large language models like ChatGPT are pushing discovery of travel options up-stream and will compress a jumbled process into a tidy set of personalized choices, sometimes without leaving the AI platform to visit a booking site like Expedia or Booking.com."
external.title: AI Impacts - Cracks Emerge in the Online Travel Agency (OTA) Oligopoly

📌 AI Boom vs. Dot-Com Bubble: Key Differences and Cybersecurity Implications https://www.cyberhub.blog/article/16581-ai-boom-vs-dot-com-bubble-key-differences-and-cybersecurity-implications

external.description:
The current surge in artificial intelligence (AI) adoption draws comparisons to the dot-com bubble of the 1990s, but key differences suggest a more sustainable trajectory. Unlike the dot-com era, characterized by speculative investments in unprofitable ventures, the AI boom is driven by established tech giants such as Microsoft, Google, and Nvidia. These companies are generating tangible revenue through advanced models like Large Language Models (LLMs), with infrastructure spending on data centers and specialized chips projected to reach hundreds of billions of dollars by 2025.

From a cybersecurity perspective, the rapid adoption of AI presents both opportunities and challenges. On one hand, the involvement of established players with validated business models mitigates financial risks. On the other, the concentration of AI development in a few major players could create centralized points of failure, attracting the attention of threat actors. Additionally, the pace of AI adoption may outstrip regulatory frameworks, leading to governance gaps.

One critical concern is the energy consumption associated with AI technologies. Data centers and specialized chips require significant power, raising questions about sustainability and potential vulnerabilities in energy infrastructure. Moreover, the use of LLMs and other AI models introduces new attack vectors, such as adversarial attacks aimed at manipulating model outputs or compromising training data.

For cybersecurity professionals, the implications are clear. First, there is a need to secure the infrastructure supporting AI technologies, including data centers and specialized hardware. Second, robust measures must be implemented to protect AI models from adversarial attacks and ensure the integrity of training data. Finally, the rapid pace of AI adoption underscores the importance of developing and implementing comprehensive regulatory frameworks to address emerging risks.

While the AI boom shares some similarities with the dot-com bubble, the fundamental differences—particularly the involvement of established players and tangible revenue streams—suggest a more sustainable path. However, cybersecurity professionals must remain vigilant to address the unique challenges posed by this technological shift.
external.title: AI Boom vs. Dot-Com Bubble: Key Differences and Cybersecurity Implications

record.text: 📌 Ethical Hacking in Gaming: Manfred's Reverse Engineering Insights https://www.cyberhub.blog/article/16580-ethical-hacking-in-gaming-manfreds-reverse-engineering-insights

external.description: Manfred, a hacker specializing in video games, combines reverse engineering and ethical black hat hacking as his full-time profession. This work is featured in the second part of a series from the Darknet Diaries podcast, available in German. The article does not provide concrete details about specific tools or vulnerabilities exploited, nor does it mention any specific impact, date, or location. Reverse engineering in video games involves analyzing game code to understand its functionality and identify potential vulnerabilities. Ethical black hat hacking refers to the practice of using hacking skills for legitimate purposes, such as identifying and reporting security flaws to developers before they can be exploited maliciously. The implications of Manfred's work highlight the importance of proactive security measures in the gaming industry. By identifying vulnerabilities through reverse engineering, ethical hackers can help developers patch security flaws, thereby protecting players from potential exploits. However, the lack of specific details in the article about the tools or vulnerabilities makes it challenging to assess the direct impact of his work on the broader cybersecurity landscape. From a cybersecurity perspective, the gaming industry presents unique challenges due to its interactive nature and the potential for exploits that can affect both game integrity and player security. Ethical hackers like Manfred play a crucial role in enhancing the security posture of gaming platforms and applications. Their work not only helps in identifying and mitigating vulnerabilities but also raises awareness about the importance of robust security practices in game development. In conclusion, while the article provides a fascinating glimpse into the world of ethical hacking in gaming, the absence of specific technical details limits a deeper analysis. Nevertheless, the role of ethical hackers in improving cybersecurity within the gaming industry is undeniable and underscores the need for continued collaboration between hackers and developers to ensure a safer gaming environment.
